reviewText: Hello out there & welcome to this, this is a review in my on going series where I reviewed old Professional Wresting Pay Per Views. Last time I reviewed King Of The Ring 99 a mediocre show look for it in the discussion part in Hello out there & welcome to this, this is a review in my long running series of reviewing old Professional WreThe King Of The Ring 1999 reviews cause for some reason Amazon put the 98 & 99 King Of The Ring reviews together & couldn't review it so I just put it in the discussion part. Now these reviews I aim towards people who grew up watching wrestling during The Attitude Era like me, or if you never got to experience The Attitude Era then read away but more than likely you found this review randomly whatever the reason let's get to this review. At a press conference on July 14th 1999 The WWF announced that at Summerslam Jesse "The Body" Ventura would be The Special Guest Referee. On The June 28th episode of RAW IS WAR Stone Cold Steve Austin announced on the night of King Of The Ring he made himself a new contract where he $5 million a year & he can now beat up Vince anytime he wants. He also gave himself a match for against The Undertaker for The WWF Championship that night Stone Cold Steve Austin defeated The Undertaker to become WWF Champion for the 4th time. The Undertaker beat Austin down after the match & he cut his head open. On the following Sunday Night Heat The Undertaker made a challenge for a rematch for The WWF Championship at Fully Loaded only he wanted to be a First Blood Match. The next night on RAW IS WAR Austin accepted but Vince McMahon came out he wanted some stipulations added & wanted it put in a contract cause 1 of them has to go & go for good. McMahon said he can go to his Lawyers & get the contract drawn stating that if Austin wins McMahon can never appear on TV again but if The Undertaker wins then Austin can never again go for The WWF Championship. The next week on RAW IS WAR during The Contract Signing The Undertaker busted Austin open The Undertaker took McMahon's filling pen & McMahon signed the contract in Austin's blood. Later that night Austin wanted The Undertaker in match with no rules & no Referee. Big Show who was having problems with Kane wanted to help Austin cause The Undertaker & Kane have reunited so their was a good Tag Team Match on RAW & Austin & Big Show won however Austin was busted open after getting sewed up. The next week on RAW IS WAR Stone Cold brought a truck from a Blood Bank which he put The Undertaker in so he had all the blood he needs then he went & busted open Vince McMahon really bad I mean Vince did a manly blade job. While Austin was drinking beer Paul Bearer got The Undertaker out of the truck & he went after Austin & cut him open with a beer can to continue keeping the wound fresh. On The July 5th episode of RAW IS WAR The Rock defeated Triple H in a Cage Match now Triple H was out of the cage 1st with the help of Chyna but The Referee was knocked out so on the following Heat we found out there would be a Strap Match to decide a Number 1 Contender at Fully Loaded. On The June 28th episode of RAW IS WAR Triple H talked Mr A  _  - into teaming up with Chyna in getting the rights to D Generation X from X Pac & Road Dogg. The next week on RAW IS WAR Chyna filed a Police Complaint for Vandalism of her Car & she said it was X Pac & Road Dogg & they were arrested. On the following Sunday Night Heat Chyna admitted that it wasn't her car. The on The July 19th episode of RAW IS WAR The Road Dogg took Chyna on in a Dog Collar Match but Mr @  _  _ interfered & they tried to hang The Road Dogg with the chain but X Pac made the save. On The June 28th episode of RAW IS WAR Steve Blackman further injured Ken Shamrock after giving him internal injuries that he have him the night before at King Of The Ring. On The July 12th episode of RAW IS WAR Ken Shamrock came back & went after Steve Blackman & they fought their way all the way to the back. On the following Heat Ken Shamrock told a story about when he was younger when he had problems with someone he would fight them outside of a bar where people would park their cars & form a circle of cars & they wold fight it out. So he wanted Blackman at Fully Loaded in Non Sanctioned Iron Circle Match. On The July 11th episode of Heat Gangrel turned on Edge then on The July 19th episode of RAW IS WAR after Jeff Jarrett defended The IC title against Christian Jarrett got a Blood Bath Edge came out Jarrett blamed Edge he challenged him at Fully Loaded but the night before Fully Loaded at a House Show Edge defeated Jeff Jarrett to win The WWF Intercontinental Championship. On The July 5th episode of RAW IS WAR The Hardy Boyz defeat The Acolytes to win The WWF Tag Team Championship.  Those were the important events leading into this Pay Per View the buyrate was a 1.07 that is up from Fully Loaded IYH that got an 0.90.The champions at the time wereWWF Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin June 28th 1999WWF Intercontinental Champion Edge July 24th 1999WWF European Champion June 21st 1999 Mideon found the title belt in 1 of Shane McMahon's bags & declared himself European ChampionWWF Tag Team Championship The Hardy Boyz Matt & Jeff June 29th 1999 match aired July 5th 1999WWF Hardcore Champion Al Snow April 25th 1999WWF Women's Champion Ivory June 8th 1999 aired June 14th 1999Date July 25, 1999Attendance 16,605Venue Marine Midland ArenaCity Buffalo, New YorkHEAT1There was an opening video package for the main event good.Val Venis Def Joey Abs with The Mean Street Posse *Test came out & went after The Posse after the match Test tried to put down Joey Abs where he put a chair on his leg & he was going to jump off the top rope on it but Pete Gas & Rodney ran him off with chairs.A really good video package was show for The Rights To DX Match.Jim Ross interviewed X Pac & Road Dogg. Road Dogg said that DX was about having a good time X Pac said it was about staying true to your crew.Jerry "The King" Lawler interviewed Mr @  _  _ & Chyna he said that DX for them is about 7 figures quarterly. Chyna said that they can keep their loyalty they'll take the money. Mr @  _  _ said as far is he knows the name JOB Squad isn't taken.Teri Runnels was talking to Meat.They show a countdown to Chris Jericho was coming to The WWF.The Godfather with The H  o's Def Meat with Teri Runnels & Jacqueline DUDafter the match Teri Runnels poured ice water down Meat's trunks.A great video package was shown for The Strap Match between The Rock & HHH.Then they show where Jim Ross interviewed Triple H a couple of days earlier if you never got to see this go find find it.They show Stone Cold in the back as well as The Undertaker arriving to the arena.They show a GTV segment where actor Ben Stiller was caught talking about Debra's Puppies.Christian Def Viscera DUDGangrel came out spit red liquid in Viscera's face helping Christian get the win. They also announced that Edge won The Intercontinental title the night before at a House Show.An awesome video package was show for The First Blood End Of An Era MatchJim Ross interviewed Stone Cold Steve Austin Ross said it might be his last time interviewing him as WWF Champion Austin said that just ain't going to happen Undertaker attacked Austin & bashed his head open & he was bleeding as The McMahon's looked on.The opening was pretty good.They show where Stone Cold was getting medical attention.Michael Cole interviewed Vince McMahon he said he had nothing to do with The Undertaker jumping Austin on Heat.WWF Intercontinental ChampionshipJeff Jarrett with Debra Def Champion Edge ***a good match good way to start The PPV. Even Gangrel's interference didn't hurt.Austin left The Medical Room he went to the ring & gave Jeff Jarrett a Stunner. Austin cut a promo he said that he's going into match sewed up so he's going to make sure The Undertaker does too.Acolytes RulesWWF Tag Team ChampionshipThe Acolytes Faarooq & Bradshaw Def Champions The Hardy Boyz Matt & Jeff & Michael PS Hayes ** & 3 quarters of a star.A more than decent match.Stone Cold was looking for Undertaker in the backThen we go to Kevin Kelly who interviewed D'Lo Brown who was going for The European title he made it short & sweetWWF European ChampionshipD'Lo Brown Def Champion Mideon * & 3 quartersMichael Cole interviewed Al Snow who was more out of his mind than usual.WWF Hardcore ChampionshipThe Big Boss Man Def Champion Al Snow ** & a quarter of a starbasically Prince Albert put a spike into Head & on the previous RAW Al Snow begged for Big Boss Man to put him out of his misery which he got a beating for The Boss Man. I thought this was going to be garbage but The Big Boss Man made it work.They show where the past few weeks Kane & The Big Show had been feuding & where he joined his Brother The Undertaker they had been owning Big Show but Undertaker Choke Slammed X Pac & he showed he was loyal to X Pac.Kevin Kelly interviewed Hardcore Holly who was going to be The Special Guest Referee for The Kane Big Show match he said he won't be partial for The Big Show & he claimed he could beat up both The Big Show & Kane.The Big Show Def Kane * Hardcore Holly was The Special Guest RefereeHolly fast counted Kane X Pac came out & gave Holly a spin kick The Undertaker came out & Choke Slammed X Pac then Big Show joined in giving the boots to X Pac & Kane.Backstage The Undertaker was jumped by Austin & he cut his head open.Iron Circle not sanctioned by The WWFKen Shamrock Def Steve Blackman ***this was actually good I remember it being bad when I rented The VHS when I 14 I thought The Hardcore Division was great as well as the 24-7 rule as well.Terry Taylor interviewed The Undertaker & he was knocked out of the way.Michael Cole interviewed Chyna & Mr @  _  _.Rights To D Generation XX Pac & Road Dogg Def Mr A  *  * & Chyna **They show Austin getting ready in the back.Then they show a great video package for The Fully Loaded Strap Match between The Rock & Triple H.Fully Loaded Strap MatchTriple H Def The Rock *** & 3 quarters of a star a really good match considering it's a strap match. The match also has the distinction of JR saying The Rock just jerked Helmsley of  f. Mr @  *  * interfered in the match & helped Triple H beat The Rock & Billy Gunn went on to work with The Rock & he was a a main event tank.They show a awesome video package for The First blood End Of An Era Match between Stone Cold & The UndertakerFirst Blood End Of Era MatchWWF ChampionshipChampion Stone Cold Steve Austin Def The Undertaker with Paul Bearer & Vince McMahon on commentary **** & quarters of a staras a result of The Undertaker losing Vince McMahon could not be on TV anymore. Yeah Right.Had Austin lost he could never again challenge for The WWF ChampionshipA great match cause you had 2 men going in having been fresh wounds & doing everything not to bleed Austin makingd  *  *  n sure he wouldn't have what happened to him the last 3 times again. Taking out Shane McMahon with a chair X Pac figured into the match After the match Triple H came out to go after Austin The Rock came out went after HHH then there was a wild brawl with Austin & Taker Vince was in the ring near to tears. Then I just loved it when Austin was in the ring & McMahon put his hand out & he got a Stunner. I almost want to give this match 5 stars cause it was close to perfect.In a Home Video exclusive Michael Cole interviewed Triple H who said he knows Austin better than he knows himself he knows what he's going to do before he does it. He said Austin maybe The Toughest SOB but he can't beat him when it comes to wrestling.Fully Loaded was a really good show. If you can can get this show for $10 or under I'd get it. The IC title match was good. The Iron Circle Match was good matches I thought were going to be bad like The Hardcore title match turned out to be half way decent. The Rock vs Triple H Strap Match was really good. Undertaker vs Austin was near 5 stars. If you want to see this Pay Per View as well go watch ST Valentines Day Massacre In Your House & Backlash In Your House those were Pay Per Views that came after major Pay Per Views that blew. Next Pay Per View review will be for Summerslam 99 which will it be like The Royal Rumble 99 Wrestlemania XV & King Of The Ring 99 or will it do what a major Pay Per View should do & deliver.
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: Awesome p.p.v here is the complete list of matches and my ratings for each.1=lowest 5=highestHardcore title=Al Snow vs. Big Bossman 3 1/2Edge vs. Jef Jarret 4 great match great openerMideon vs. D'lo was goodHardyz and Michael hayes vs. The Acolytes 3 1/2Rights to Dx name 4Strap match 5 awesome match one of the best matches everBig Show vs. Kane very cool 4Fisrt Blood 5 very good
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: 1st match edge vs jeff jarett winner jeff jarett. 2nd match apa vs hardy boyzs winners apa. 3rd match mideon vs d low brown winner d low brown. 4th match al snow vs big boss man i love hardcore matches winner big boss man. 5th match big show vs kane winner big show. 6th match ken shamrock vs steve blackman winner ken shamrock. 7th match billy gunn and chyna vs road dogg and x pac winners road dogg and x pac. 8th match triple h vs the rock winner triple h. 9th match first blood match steve auston vs undertaker if you do not like blood than do not watch this match or this pay per view winner steve auston.
summary: this pay per view is great
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: i liked the plot message and format of the storys and matches. but im tired of austin vs mcmahnon main events im not happy about watching a superstar beat the hell outta a nobody12/12/02
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: The WWF did an excellent job on their July 1999 PPV event.  Fully Loaded 1999 definitely surpassed the 1998 original.  With 5 titles on the line, the action was hotter than ever.  In the main event it was the First  Blood-End of an Era match for the WWF Championship between Champion-Stone  Cold Steve Austin and The Undertaker.  Edge defends his newly won  Intercontinental Title against former champ Jeff Jarrett.  Tag Team  Champions-The Hardy Boyz with Michael Hayes defend against the Acolytes.  The European Title is up for grabs between Mideon and D-Lo Brown.  For the  Hardcore Title, Champion-Al Snow takes on the Big Boss Man.  Also the Fully  Loaded Strap Match between HHH and the Rock.  The winner of this match  becomes the #1 contender for the WWF Title.  The battle for DX as Road Dogg  Jesse James and X-Pac take on Chyna and the 1999 King of the Ring-Mr. Ass.  A grudge match between Kane and the Big Show with Hardcore Holly as the  special guest referee.  Definitely a must-see event for any wrestling fan.
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: This event was one of the best during the 1999 season, and is one of my all-time personal favorites during the WWF's Attitude Era.  This Pay-Per-View is a great addition to any wrestling fan's collection.  The match card is as follows:Match #1 - WWF Intercontinental ChampionshipEdge vs. Jeff JarrettMatch #2 - WWF World Tag Team Championship - No Disqualification Handicap Match"The Acolytes" (Faarooq & Bradshaw) vs. Michael Hayes & "The Hardy Boyz" (Matt & Jeff Hardy)Match #3 - WWF European ChampionshipD'Lo Brown vs. MideonMatch #4 - WWF Hardcore ChampionshipThe Big Boss Man vs. Al SnowMatch #5 - Singles MatchBig Show vs. Kanew/ Hardcore Holly as the guest refereeMatch #6 - Iron Circle MatchKen Shamrock vs. Steve BlackmanMatch #7 - Tag Match for the rights to DX"Road Dogg" Jesse James & X-Pac vs. Billy Gunn & ChynaMatch #8 - Strap MatchTriple H vs. The RockMatch #9 - WWF World Heavyweight Championship - First Blood Match"Stone Cold" Steve Austin vs. UndertakerOverall rating of event: 9.8/10
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: Another old WWF tape that I found from the Attitude Era of the WWF. The night after the King Of The Ring, Stone Cold Steve Austin regained the WWF Championship from the Undertaker but Taker showed that he wasn't done with Austin yet in proceeding to bust Austin open (along with doing the same act in constant weeks prior to the PPV) & challenging him to a First Blood match which for those that remember was the same match that Taker had cost Austin the title a year before. However the bigger story was Vince McMahon raising the stakes that guaranteed one way or another, this event would mark "The End Of An Era".Intercontinental Champion Edge vs Jeff Jarrett. The night before at a house show in Toronto, Edge won his first singles title so this was the rematch. And just like his match with Owen Hart months before at BreakDown, Edge held his own against the veteran Jarrett in what was a good back & forth match with Gangrel getting involved at the end & Debra being quite the sight at ringside.Acolyte Rules: WWF Tag Team Champions Hardy Boyz & Michael Hayes vs Acolytes. This was just a glorified handicap match with the rules being that the Acolytes can win the tag titles no matter who they pin. These two teams didn't disappoint as this was just a brawl around the ring with one moment to check out would be this clothesline that Bradshaw delivered to Jeff while in mid-air. Hayes didn't slow down the action but it was his mistake that cost his team the match that eventually lead to the Hardyz leaving Hayes in the future.WWF European Champion Mideon vs D'Lo Brown. After months of the European title being on the shelf, it returns here but this was the first flop of the night as Mideon does nothing for me as a performer & D'Lo just wasn't good able to bring out a good performance out of Mideon.Hardcore Champion Al Snow vs Big Bossman. This match had a wierd storyline as Snow was begging Bossman to put him out of his misery due the "Head" driving him crazy for the past couple weeks. Anyways, this match followed the hardcore pattern that the WWF did at this point as they brawled around the arena using various weapons including a golf cart before they would out into the streets with Bossman handcuffing Snow up against the fense to win the match & the title.Kane vs Big Show w/Special Referee Hardcore Holly. Holly was just added to the match for some comedy based on his interactions with both men throughout the couple of weeks leading to this match. Even though this did get slow at times, this was actually a good "big man vs big man" match as this was better than their previous KOTR match or even their dull Backlash 2006 encounter with the aftermath featuring Undertaker & X-Pac that planted the seeds for their tag team match at SummerSlam a month later.Iron Circle Match: Ken Shamrock vs Steve Blackman. This resembled the Parking Lot Brawls that they would do a couple of years later involving Cena/Guerrero as they just brawled in the parking lot surrounded with cars with some of the cars coming into effect at one point before Shamrock ended things with a steel chain."Rights To The DX Name": X-Pac & Road Dogg vs Billy Gunn & Chyna. The stipulation to this match was that the winning team would get the rights to use the DX name. Anyways, this was the surprise of the night as everyone put forth a good effort & delivered a match that would have came off as a filler but made it fun to watch with moments like the interaction between Gunn/Dogg & even Chyna/X-Pac as we see Chyna dominate with her strength.Fully Loaded Strap Match: The Rock vs Triple H. The winner of this match would face the WWF Champion at SummerSlam. This was a different strap match than most fans tend to expect as this didn't have the "touch the four corners rule" with the way to win being by pinfall/submission anywhere in the building. Out of all their matches, this was probably their stiffest match with both men using the leather strap at various times like Triple H choking Rock from the top turnbuckle along with one moment where Rock whipped Triple H in the chest with the strap that it made me cringe. The ending involving Billy Gunn didn't take away from this match that would have been worthy for Rock or HHH's DVD sets."End Of An Era" First Blood Match: WWF Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin vs The Undertaker. The climax of the Austin/McMahon feud as the stipulations here were that if Taker won, Austin couldn't get a title match ever again while if Austin won, McMahon would be forced to leave the WWF. Before the match, Vince McMahon decided to do commentary for this match. On top of that earlier in the night, both men were attacked & busted open by one another. This was a physical brawl between these two with both men selling the effect of their attack from earlier with Shane McMahon taking one of the hardest chairshots that I have ever seen in wrestling. Along with cameos from X-Pac, Triple H, The Rock & Vince McMahon, this was a wild encounter with a surprising aftermath to conclude one of the best feuds in WWF history.In the end, there was only really one bad match on the card while the rest of the undercard also had some good matches along with progressing the storylines they were pushing at the time with the two main events being the highlights of this show so this is one I would check out if you find it at a cheap price.
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: MATCH 1: INTERCONTINENTAL TITLE: Edge Vs Jeff Jarrett - 6.5/10A good opener but interference from various people spoils it.MATCH 2: ACOLYTE RULES: TAG TITLES: Michael Hayes + Hardy Boys Vs The Acolytes - 6/10Just a brawl.MATCH 3: EUROPEAN TITLE: Mideon Vs D'LO Brown - 5/10Very boring.MATCH 4: HARDCORE TITLE: Al Snow Vs Big Boss Man - 8/10This match was great, it ended up across the street from the arena.MATCH 5: Kane Vs The Big Show - 3/10DUDMATCH 6: IRON CIRCLE MATCH: Steve Blackman Vs Ken Shamrock - 0/10Confusing mess of a match.MATCH 7: RIGHTS TO DX NAME: Billy Gunn + Chyna Vs Road Dogg + X-Pac - 7/10Great match where the right team won.MATCH 8: FULLY LOADED STRAP MATCH: Triple H Vs The Rock - 8/10Different to normal strap matchesMATCH 9: FIRST BLOOD MATCH: WWF TITLE: Stone Cold Vs The Undertaker - 5/10Wow, this match put me to sleep.Overall Event Rating: 5/10
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: The First Blood End of an Era match is worth getting the tape. There are some other cool matches, like the Fully Loaded Strap Match between The Rock and Triple H to decide the No. 1 contender for the WWF title at Summerslam,  and the first ever Iron Circle match between Ken Shamrock and Steve  Blackman (my favorite match on the tape) The other matches aren't as  entertaining as these 3 in my opinion, but they're worth buying the tape
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: The middle part of the show sucked, but the beginning and ending portions were bordering on OK. The best match of the show was the handicap tag match. The show had two matches in the ** to *** range, three matches from * to **, and four DUDs. 2nd best WWF PPV of 99 that I saw, (Royal Rumble, WrestleMania, Over The Edge, this show, No Mercy, and Armageddon) but that isn't saying much.
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: This is better than the first Fully loaded Undertaker and Austin took it to each other.  Beating the hell out of each other.  And when the smoke cleared Austin reigned surpreme.  The strap match was amazing I liked every  match on here.  I ordered it on pay per view so I highly recommend this  tape!!
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: 1999 Fully LoadedJuly 25, 1999Marine Midland ArenaBuffalo, New YorkWWF Intercontinental Championship:Edge (Champion) V. Jeff JarrettEdge won the title the night before in Toronto at a house show. The match itself wasn't bad but could have been better. Jarrett wins the title. ***WWF European Championship:Mideon (Champion) V. D'Lo Brownhorrible match what was slow and well...slow. D'Lo win the European Championship! *Handicap Match for the WWF Tag Team Championship:Hardy Boyz (Champions) & Michael Hayes V. AcolytesActually a good match. Some great spots in this match like a wacky Clothesline From Hell by Bradshaw. Acolytes win. ***1/4WWF Hardcore Championship:Al Snow (Champion) V. Big Bossmangood hardcore action but their match at Summerslam was alot better. Bossman wins. ***1/4 (I Guess)Kane V. Big ShowHorrible match. Show wins. 3/4*Iron Circle Match:Ken Shamrock V. Steve Blackmanthis match was good I guess. There was no blood and no really big spots. Shamrock wins. The rating is N/A.Road Dogg & X-Pac V. Billy Gunn & ChynaGood match but pretty underwhleming with the Roadie (I mean Road Dogg) & X-Pax win. **3/4Strap Match:The Rock V. Triple HOff night for both of these guys. This match was actually hard to watch. Triple H wins with the help of Billy Gunn. **3/4End of An Era,First Blood Match for the WWF Championship:"Stone Cold" Steve Austin (Champion) V. UndertakerGood match that again was pretty underwhelming until the end. Austin makes Taker bleed and Vince McMahon can no longer run the WWF! ***1/2Overall, a horrible show. Why is that ever time a Pay-Per-View comes to Western New York (Where I live) the shows suck.
summary: Someone will Bleed, Someone will Leave!!!
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: FULLY LOADED 99 has to be the best undercard PPV i have ever seen besides SUMMERSLAM 98 and Wrestlemania X, The Only bad match of the night was D'LO vs Mideon, Mideon should not be in a wwf PPV but besides that match every  match was non stop action packed I thought the First Blood End of an Era  could of been better but it is still a good match my favorit match of the  night was HHH vs THE ROCK in a Leather strape match, Overall This PPV is  Fully Loaded with non stop action but it is not the best PPV of 1999 it is  the best undercard PPV of 1999 but not the best Main Event i still think  WWF NO MERCY is the best PPV of 1999 I give Fully Loaded 99 a 8/10 a great  PPV.
summary: THIS WAS FULLY LOADED ALL THE WAY.
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS

reviewText: WWF Intercontinential TitleEdge (C) vs Jeff Jarrett w/DebraNot a good opener, seemed like an Raw match. Good ending though.Rating: 6/10WWF Tag Team TitlesHardy Boyz (C) and Michael Hayes vs The AcolytesGood match. The handicap match idea was stupid, but a good match. Some really good bumps in the match.Rating: 7/10WWF European TitleMideon (C) vs D'Lo BrownD'Lo carries Mideon in this match, but still a pretty crappy match.Rating: 5/10WWF Hardcore TitleAl Snow (C) vs Big Boss ManGreat match, just one of those great hardcore matches from the year. Very entertaining.Rating: 8/10Kane vs Big ShowSpecial Ref-Hardcore HollyThis match should of been better. Holly is very fun to watch though.Rating:6/10Iron Circle MatchSteve Blackman vs Ken ShamrockI expected more from this match, but still really good. Could of been longer than it was.Rating: 7/10Rights to DX MatchChyna and Mr. Ass vs X-Pac and Road DoggReally a good match. Very entertaining all the way through.Rating: 8/10#1 Contender's Match for WWF TitleStrap MatchThe Rock vs Triple HVery good, but what can you expect from these two? Good from start to finish.Rating: 8/10WWF Championship"End of an Era" MatchFirst Blood MatchThe Undertaker (C) vs Stone ColdGreat match. One of the best of the year. Really a shocking ending to this epic match.Rating: 9/10WWF Fully Loaded 1999 was a great PPV and really was fun to watch from start to finish. Must have for any wrestling fanOverall Rating: 80/100
Title: WWF: Fully Loaded 1999 VHS
